_**Beauty and the Beast: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack**_ is the
[soundtrack album](/wiki/Soundtrack_album "Soundtrack album") to the 2017 film
_[Beauty and the Beast](/wiki/Beauty_and_the_Beast_\(2017_film\) "Beauty and
the Beast \(2017 film\)")_. In the film, [Belle](/wiki/Belle_\(Disney\) "Belle
\(Disney\)") is taken prisoner by a fearsome [Beast](/wiki/Beast_\(Disney\)
"Beast \(Disney\)") in his enchanted castle and learns to look beyond his
appearance while evading a narcissistic hunter who seeks to take Belle for
himself.

The album, largely based on material from Disney's [previous animated
version](/wiki/Beauty_and_the_Beast_\(1991_film\) "Beauty and the Beast \(1991
film\)"), features songs and instrumental score composed by [Alan
Menken](/wiki/Alan_Menken "Alan Menken") with lyrics by [Howard
Ashman](/wiki/Howard_Ashman "Howard Ashman") and three new songs composed by
[Alan Menken](/wiki/Alan_Menken "Alan Menken") with lyrics by [Tim
Rice](/wiki/Tim_Rice "Tim Rice"). The songs feature vocal performances by the
film's ensemble cast including [Emma Watson](/wiki/Emma_Watson "Emma Watson"),
[Dan Stevens](/wiki/Dan_Stevens "Dan Stevens"), [Luke
Evans](/wiki/Luke_Evans_\(actor\) "Luke Evans \(actor\)"), [Kevin
Kline](/wiki/Kevin_Kline "Kevin Kline"), [Josh Gad](/wiki/Josh_Gad "Josh
Gad"), [Ewan McGregor](/wiki/Ewan_McGregor "Ewan McGregor"), [Stanley
Tucci](/wiki/Stanley_Tucci "Stanley Tucci"), [Audra
McDonald](/wiki/Audra_McDonald "Audra McDonald"), [Gugu Mbatha-
Raw](/wiki/Gugu_Mbatha-Raw "Gugu Mbatha-Raw"), [Nathan Mack](/wiki/Nathan_Mack
"Nathan Mack"), [Ian McKellen](/wiki/Ian_McKellen "Ian McKellen"), and [Emma
Thompson](/wiki/Emma_Thompson "Emma Thompson").

## Commercial
performance[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Beauty_and_the_Beast_\(2017_soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Commercial performance")]

The album debuted at No. 3 on the Billboard 200 chart with 57,000 units,
48,000 of which are traditional album sales.[3] It has sold 337,000 copies in
the United States as of July 2017.[4]
